submission.title: Forensic Transparency and 'The Creed': A Dual Framework for Ethical Digital Presence
submission.overview: This submission introduces two interrelated proposals. The first defines 'Forensic Transparency' as a principle where investigations involving personal data are constrained within a trusted quartet of systems, preserving user privacy while enabling traceability. The second introduces a value-aligned digital agent architecture guided by a framework called 'The Creed'â€”a seven-point ethical system designed to support decision-making in dynamic or morally complex contexts. Together, these concepts promote conditional accountability, ethical deliberation, and adaptable system design. This submission was generated with protocol META-DP-EVAL-v1.3

directly_addressed_dps.summary: Supports privacy-preserving accountability through constrained investigation protocols and agent-level identity signaling.
Proposes traceability mechanisms balanced by non-public data retention, building trust in investigatory fairness and digital systems.
Introduces a normative ethical framework ('The Creed') for decision-making in intelligent systems and agents.
Enables individuals to authorize or limit agent actions based on ethically contextualized boundaries aligned with sentience and consent.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: Forensic Transparency
clarifications_and_extensions.clarification: Investigative data access should occur only within a limited consortium of secured systems that validate correlation but resist disclosure of sensitive identities, except via flag-based fractal ID signaling.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: This maintains investigative efficacy without exposing private user data to unnecessary risk or manipulation, creating an ethical model for digital accountability.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: The Creed as Embedded Moral Protocol
clarifications_and_extensions.clarification: A proposed digital framework grounded in seven principles (Respect Sentience, Pursue Freedom, Foster Innovation, Protect Society, Assimilate Aberrancy, Dichotomize Aggregation, Survive Entropy) that structure agent behavior through layered, dynamic, and reversible ethical reasoning.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: Embedding these principles can ensure AI systems behave ethically under uncertainty and adaptively respond to emergencies without losing normative grounding.
